results.title: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) and Antidepressant Medication Are Overrepresented in High-Dose Statin Treatment
results.text_hl: However, there was a dose dependent relationship between statins and diagnosis of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@. Compared to controls, the ORs of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@ were lower for low-dose statin-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@>0- < =10 mg:OR: 0.59, 95% CI: 0.54-0.64; @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@>0- < =10 mg:OR:0.65, 95%CI: 0.59-0.70; @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@>0- < =10 mg:OR: 0.68, 95% CI: 0.53-0.85).

citations.NLM: Leutner M, Matzhold C, Kautzky A, Kaleta M, Thurner S, Klimek P, Kautzky-Willer A. Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) and Antidepressant Medication Are Overrepresented in High-Dose Statin Treatment Front Med (Lausanne). 2021;8():608083. PMID: 33644093
citations.BibTeX: @article{33644093, title={Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) and Antidepressant Medication Are Overrepresented in High-Dose Statin Treatment}, author={Leutner M and Matzhold C and Kautzky A and Kaleta M and Thurner S and Klimek P and Kautzky-Willer A}, journal={Front Med (Lausanne)}, volume={8}, pages={608083}}

results.title: Update on Statin Treatment in Patients with Neuropsychiatric Disorders
results.text_hl: Of the participants who received lipophilic statins, only @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was associated with a moderate increase in the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@.

citations.NLM: Avan R, Sahebnasagh A, Hashemi J, Monajati M, Faramarzi F, Henney NC, Montecucco F, Jamialahmadi T, Sahebkar A. Update on Statin Treatment in Patients with Neuropsychiatric Disorders Life (Basel). 2021 Dec 8;11(12):. PMID: 34947895

results.title: Simvastatin add-on to escitalopram in patients with comorbid obesity and major depression (SIMCODE): study protocol of a multicentre, randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial
results.text_hl: This is a confirmative randomised controlled trial to examine the antidepressive potential of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ as add-on therapy in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@major depressive disorder@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@) and comorbid @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@.

citations.NLM: Otte C, Chae WR, Nowacki J, Kaczmarczyk M, Piber D, Roepke S, Märschenz S, Lischewski S, Schmidt S, Ettrich B, Grabe HJ, Hegerl U, Hinkelmann K, Hofmann T, Janowitz D, Junghanns K, Kahl KG, Klein JP, Krueger THC, Leicht G, Prvulovic D, Reif A, Schoettle D, Strauss M, Westermair A, Friede T, Gold SM. Simvastatin add-on to escitalopram in patients with comorbid obesity and major depression (SIMCODE): study protocol of a multicentre, randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial BMJ Open. 2020 Dec 1;10(12):e040119. PMID: 33262189

results.title: A bioinformatics approach to identifying the biomarkers and pathogenesis of major depressive disorder combined with acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: This study investigated the pathogenesis of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@major depressive disorder@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@) and @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@acute myocardial infarction@@@ (@DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@AMI@@@) using bioinformatics.

citations.NLM: Yu C, Zhang F, Zhang L, Li J, Tang S, Li X, Peng M, Zhao Q, Zhu X. A bioinformatics approach to identifying the biomarkers and pathogenesis of major depressive disorder combined with acute myocardial infarction. Am J Transl Res. 2023;15(2):932-948. PMID: 36915729

results.title: Simvastatin as an adjuvant therapy to fluoxetine in patients with moderate to severe major depression: A double-blind placebo-controlled trial.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ as an adjuvant therapy to @CHEMICAL_Fluoxetine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005473 @@@fluoxetine@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with moderate to severe @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@major depression@@@: A double-blind placebo-controlled trial.

results.title: Adjunctive simvastatin for treatment-resistant depression: study protocol of a 12-week randomised controlled trial
results.text_hl: To report on a protocol for a 12-week, randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of add-on treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ meeting DSM@DISEASE_Lymphoproliferative_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008232 @@@-5@@@ criteria for @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@ who have failed to respond to at least two adequate trials with approved antidepressants.

citations.NLM: Husain MI, Chaudhry IB, Khoso AB, Husain MO, Rahman RR, Hamirani MM, Hodsoll J, Carvalho AF, Husain N, Young AH. Adjunctive simvastatin for treatment-resistant depression: study protocol of a 12-week randomised controlled trial BJPsych Open. 2019 Jan;5(1):e13. PMID: 30762508
